titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Petition regarding a lighthouse at Sands Point, New York 1977.641
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:39:24 +0000.

did.unittitle: Petition regarding a lighthouse at Sands Point, New York
did.abstract: A petition to the United States Congress to build a lighthouse at Sands Point, Long Island, N.Y. for the safe passage of ships to New York City. The document is dated 1792 and its creator is unknown.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Petition regarding a lighthouse at Sands Point, New York, 1977.641, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
